chapter.title: ⪪ Installation
chapter.para: ⪪ is distributed as an add-on product for &sls; 11 systems. Just install the &sls; 11 base system to get ⪪ as well. You can choose to install the ⪪ add-on together with your base system during the initial installation process, or you can install the ⪪ add-on on top of an already-installed base system at any later time.

sect1.title: Installation During the Initial Installation Process
sect1.para: To install ⪪ add-on together with your base system during the initial installation process, follow these steps:

step.para: Start the &sls; 11 installation as usual. For more information, see the &sls; documentation.
To include the ⪪ add-on product, check the Include Add-On Products from Separate Media option in the Installation Mode dialog in the System Analysis step, and click Next.

In the next dialog, click Add and, if you are installing ⪪ from a CD medium, select CD as the source type. If you are installing from a different source, such as NFS or HTTP, choose the appropriate source type. Click Next.
If you are installing from a CD, insert the ⪪ add-on product CD. If you are installing from a different source, provide the necessary source. Click Continue.
Confirm the ⪪ license agreement and click Next.

The ⪪ add-on product is displayed in the overview. Continue with the installation as usual. Make sure that the ⪪: Subscription Management Tool for SLE installation pattern is selected automatically and do not remove it.
A two-step ⪪ Configuration Wizard is shown during the final steps of the installation workflow. Configure ⪪ as described in and continue with the &sls; installation as usual.

sect1.title: Installation on Top of an Already Installed System
sect1.para: To install ⪪ on top of an already-installed base system, follow these steps:

step.para: Start &yast; and select Software Add-On Product .
If you are installing ⪪ from a CD, select CD as the source type. If you are installing from a different source, such as NFS or HTTP, choose the appropriate source type. Click Next.
If you are installing from a CD, insert the ⪪ add-on product CD. If you are installing from a different source, provide the necessary source. Click Continue.
Confirm the ⪪ license agreement and click Next.
Click Accept to install the ⪪: Subscription Management Tool for SLE pattern.
The ⪪ Configuration Wizard is launched. See .

sect1.title: ⪪ Configuration Wizard
sect1.para: During the installation of ⪪ the two-step ⪪ Configuration Wizard is launched, regardless of the used installation method. Configure ⪪ using this wizard. However, you will be able to change the configuration later using the &yast; ⪪ Configuration module.

step.para: The Enable Subscription Management Tool service (⪪) option is checked by default. Uncheck it only if you want to disable the installed ⪪.
If the firewall is enabled, check Open Port in Firewall to allow access to the ⪪ service from remote computers.

Enter your &ncc; mirroring credentials in NU User and NU Password. NU stands for Novell Update. If you do not know your &ncc; credentials, refer to . Test the entered credentials by pressing the Test button. ⪪ will connect to the Customer Center server using the provided credentials and download some testing data.
Enter the e-mail address you have used for the &ncc; registration into NCC E-mail Used for Registration.
Your ⪪ Server URL should contain the URL of the ⪪ server being configured. It is populated automatically.
Press Next to continue to the second configuration step.
For security reasons, enter smt as username in the database and select a ⪪ Database Password in the respective fields. The password must be entered.
Enter all e-mail addresses that ⪪ should send reports to using the Add button. You are also able to Edit or Delete any incorrect or needless addresses.
Press Next.
If the current MySQL root password is empty—as in any freshly installed system— you will be asked to enter a New MySQL Root Password.
